document_data.caption: A rolled-up hammock.
document_data.name: Hammock
document_data.mainbody: A '''hammock''' was a type of suspended bedding.
document_data.Description:
A hammock was a sort of [[blanket]] woven through with sturdy cords such that it could be hung above the ground between two vertical supports, most commonly two trees.

Hammocks were typically made of hemp or [[linen]] and weighed about {{SI|2|lbs.|k|long=yes}}.

By the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], the cost for someone in [[Faer√ªn]] to purchase an imported hammock was a [[silver piece]].
document_data.History:
[[File:Feyr.5e.jpg|thumb|273px|''A hammock user sleeps soundly, not knowing a [[feyr]] lurks overhead.'']]
The hammock was invented on the continent of [[Maztica]].
document_data.Notable Users: Hammocks were widely popular among sailors and [[ranger]]s.
